020
021import net.tnemc.item.AbstractItemStack;
022import net.tnemc.item.providers.CalculationsProvider;
023import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.helper.CraftingRecipe;
024import net.tnemc.plugincore.core.compatibility.scheduler.SchedulerProvider;
025import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
026import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
027import revxrsal.commands.command.CommandActor;
028
029import java.io.InputStream;
030import java.util.Optional;
031import java.util.Set;
032import java.util.UUID;
033import java.util.regex.Pattern;
034
035/**
036 * Acts like a bridge between various server software and classes specific to each server software
037 * such as opening menus, and sending messages.
038 *
039 * @author creatorfromhell
040 * @since 0.1.2.0
041 */
042public interface ServerConnector {
043
044  /**
045   * The name of this implementation.
046   *
047   * @return The name of the implementation.
048   */
049  String name();
050
051  /**
052   * Used to replace placeholders from a string.
053   *
054   * @param player  The player to use for the placeholder replacement.
055   * @param message The message to replace placeholders in.
056   *
057   * @return The string after placeholders have been replaced.
058   */
059  String replacePlaceholder(final UUID player, final String message);
060
061  /**
062   * The proxy provider to use for this implementation.
063   *
064   * @return The proxy provider to use for this implementation.
065   */
066  ProxyProvider proxy();
067
068  /**
069   * Used to convert an {@link CommandActor} to a {@link CmdSource}.
070   *
071   * @return The {@link CmdSource} for this actor.
072   */
073  CmdSource<?> source(@NotNull CommandActor actor);
074
075  /**
076   * Retrieves a set of online player names.
077   *
078   * @return Set of online player names.
079   */
080  Set<String> onlinePlayersList();
081
082  /**
083   * Used to get the amount of online players.
084   *
085   * @return The amount of online players.
086   */
087  int onlinePlayers();
088
089  /**
090   * Attempts to find a {@link PlayerProvider player} based on an {@link UUID identifier}.
091   *
092   * @param identifier The identifier
093   *
094   * @return An Optional containing the located {@link PlayerProvider player}, or an empty Optional
095   * if no player is located.
096   */
097  Optional<PlayerProvider> findPlayer(@NotNull UUID identifier);
098
099  /**
100   * This is used to return an instance of an {@link PlayerProvider player} based on the provided
101   * instance's player object.
102   *
103   * @param player The instance of the player.
104   *
105   * @return The initialized {@link PlayerProvider player object}.
106   */
107  PlayerProvider initializePlayer(@NotNull Object player);
108
109  /**
110   * Used to get a cached UUID based on a username.
111   *
112   * @param name The name to use for the check.
113   *
114   * @return The UUID from the cached player. If no data with the player name exists, this will not
115   * check the MojangAPI, it'll instead generate a random UUID.
116   */
117  default UUID getCached(final String name) {
118
119    return UUID.randomUUID();
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Used to determine if this player has played on this server before.
124   *
125   * @param uuid The {@link UUID} that is associated with the player.
126   *
127   * @return True if the player has played on the server before, otherwise false.
128   */
129  boolean playedBefore(UUID uuid);
130
131  /**
132   * Used to determine if a player with the specified username has played before.
133   *
134   * @param name The username to search for.
135   *
136   * @return True if someone with the specified username has played before, otherwise false.
137   */
138  boolean playedBefore(final String name);
139
140  /**
141   * Used to determine if a player with the specified username is online.
142   *
143   * @param name The username to search for.
144   *
145   * @return True if someone with the specified username is online.
146   */
147  boolean online(final String name);
148
149  /**
150   * Used to locate a UUID for a specific name. This could be called from either a primary or
151   * secondary thread, and should not call back to the Mojang API ever.
152   *
153   * @param name The name to use for the search.
154   *
155   * @return An optional containing the UUId if exists, otherwise false.
156   */
157  Optional<UUID> fromName(final String name);
158
159  /**
160   * Used to locate a username for a specific name. This could be called from either a primary or
161   * secondary thread, and should not call back to the Mojang API ever.
162   *
163   * @param id The {@link UUID} to use for the search.
164   *
165   * @return An optional containing the name if exists, otherwise false.
166   */
167  Optional<String> fromID(final UUID id);
168
169  /**
170   * Returns the {@link Pattern pattern} utilized to determine if a string is a valid player
171   * username.
172   *
173   * @return The {@link Pattern pattern} to use for determining if a string is a valid player
174   * username.
175   *
176   * @see Pattern
177   */
178  default Pattern playerMatcher() {
179
180    return Pattern.compile("^\\w*$");
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Returns the name of the default world.
185   *
186   * @return The name of the default world.
187   */
188  String defaultWorld();
189
190  /**
191   * Determines if a plugin with the correlating name is currently installed.
192   *
193   * @param name The name to use for our check.
194   *
195   * @return True if a plugin with that name exists, otherwise false.
196   */
197  default boolean pluginAvailable(final String name) {
198
199    return false;
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Used to replace colour codes in a string.
204   *
205   * @param string The string to format.
206   * @param strip  If true, the color codes are striped from the string.
207   *
208   * @return The formatted string.
209   */
210  String replaceColours(final String string, boolean strip);
211
212  /**
213   * Provides direct access to the implementation's instance of TNIL's AbstractItemStack, which acts
214   * as a builder.
215   *
216   * @return The software's implementation of {@link AbstractItemStack}.
217   */
218  AbstractItemStack<?> stackBuilder();
219
220  /**
221   * Used to save a resource from the plugin's jar file to the local system's storage.
222   *
223   * @param path    The path to the resource inside the jar.
224   * @param replace If the file exists in the local system's storage, should it be replaced?
225   */
226  void saveResource(final String path, final boolean replace);
227
228  /**
229   * Retrieves an input stream for the specified filename from the resources.
230   *
231   * @param filename The name of the file to retrieve from the resources. Cannot be null.
232   *
233   * @return An input stream for the specified file, or null if the file is not found in the
234   * resources.
235   */
236  @Nullable
237  InputStream getResource(@NotNull String filename);
238
239  /**
240   * Provides this implementation's {@link SchedulerProvider scheduler}.
241   *
242   * @return The scheduler for this implementation.
243   */
244  SchedulerProvider<?> scheduler();
245
246  /**
247   * Used to register a crafting recipe to the server.
248   *
249   * @param key    The key for the crafting recipe to be registered.
250   * @param recipe The crafting recipe to register.
251   *
252   * @see CraftingRecipe
253   */
254  void registerCrafting(@NotNull final String key, @NotNull final CraftingRecipe recipe);
255
256  <S, T extends AbstractItemStack<S>, INV> CalculationsProvider<T, S, INV> calculations();
257}
